activities_info.details: FutureMDvsCOVID is a social media handle on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube and shares accessible and relatable content to provide the broader audience with relevant information.

HMS students have created an 8 module curriculum that has been peer and faculty reviewed. The modules have been shared and used by individuals in over 90 countries and has been integrated in the mandatory curriculum of many medical schools. View our website here.

Students are volunteering in virtual roles to perform telehealth services and followup for COVID patients and in-person roles at the hospital sites to screen visitors and train HCW on reusing PPE. Additionally, clinically advanced students have the opportunity to work at a disaster relief hospital to provide Sub-I level care to COVID positive patients.
Students from across the Harvard and Boston graduate community are being matched with HCW with childcare needs.

The Mental Health Initiative focuses on providing HMS students are the broader community with wellness-related resources to decrease feelings of isolation. Students have created a calendar filled with wellness events accessible by anyone in the Harvard graduate community.

This team is working on a number of initiatives to support vulnerable populations affected by COVID-19 as well as engaging medical student service and activism that may not be related to direct clinical support. This includes housing policy activism, addressing needs from essential health staff, and liaising with broader student community in Boston and beyond re: how to support essential health staff with needs (child care, grocery shopping, etc.).
